output.form: The form element that this element is associated with (its "form owner").
body.onafterprint: Function to call after the user has printed the document
audio.controls: If this attribute is present, the browser will offer controls to allow the user to control audio playback, including volume, seeking, and pause/resume playback.
colgroup.charoff: This attribute is used to indicate the number of characters to offset the column data from the alignment characters specified by the char attribute.
optgroup.label: The name of the group of options, which the browser can use when labeling the options in the user interface.
css-property-docs:color: The color CSS property sets the foreground colour of an elements text content.
html-element-docs:col: The HTML Table Column Element (<col>) defines a column within a table and is used for defining common semantic on all common cells. It is generally found within a <colgroup> element.
meta.name: This attribute defines the name of a document-level metadata
Remix and share web pages instantly: Remix and share web pages instantly
thead.char: This attribute is used to set the character to align the cells in a column on.
input.tabindex: The position of the element in the tabbing navigation order for the current document.
body.onload: Function to call when the document has finished loading.
audio.muted: A Boolean attribute which indicates whether the audio will be initially silenced.
css-property-docs:cursor: The cursor CSS property specifies the mouse cursor displayed when the mouse pointer is over and element.
html-element-docs:strong: The HTML Strong Element (<strong>) gives text strong emphasis, typically this is displayed in bold.
html-element-docs:fieldset: The HTML element fieldset (<fieldset>) is used to group several controls as well as labels (<label>) within a web form.
a.datasrc: This attribute indicates the ID of the data source object that supplies the data this is bound to this element.
thead.bgcolor: This attribute defines the background colour of each cell of the column.
input.accesskey: A single-character that the user can press to switch input focus to the control.
css-property-docs:text-transform: The text-transform CSS property specifies how to capitalize an element's text. It can be used to make text appear in all-uppercase or all-lowercase, or wth each word capitalized.
textarea.required: This attribute specifies that the user must fill in a value before submitting a form.
keygen.disabled: This Boolean attribute indicates that the form control is not available for interaction.
html-element-docs:audio: The audio element is used to embed sound content in an HTML or XHTML document. The audio element was added as part of HTML5.
link.hreflang: This attribute indicates the language of the linked resource.
video.width: The width of the video's display area, in CSS pixels.
See where it says: See where it says https://goggles.webmaker.org/img/goggles.png? That's the URL for the current image. Replace it with the new image URL you copied in Step 1 by highlighting the old URL, right-clicking and pasting in the new link. Press Commit Changes You should now see the new image.
Great! You've successfully swapped image: Great! You've successfully swapped images. Now experiment with the rest of the page to see what else you can replace.
html-element-docs:cite: The HTML Citation Element (<cite>) contains the title of a work, such as a book, song, movie, TV show, sculpture, etc.
html-element-docs:object: The Embedded Object (<object>) element represents an external resource, which can be treated as an image, a nested browsing context, or a resource to be handled by a plugin.
css-property-docs:list-style-type: The list-style-type CSS property specifies the appearance of a list item element. As it is the only one who defaults to display:list-item, this is usually a <li> element, but can be any element with this display value.
css-property-docs:font-size: The font-size CSS property specifies the size of the font. The font size may, in turn, change the size of other items, since it is used to compute the value of em and ex length units.
html-element-docs:th: The HTML Table Header Cell Element (<th>) defines a cell that is a header for a group of cells of a table. The group of cells that the header refers to is defined by the scope and headers attribute.
table.bgcolor: This attribute defines the background colour of the table and its content.
fieldset.name: The name associated with the group, which is submitted with the form data.
html-element-docs:td: The HTML Table Cell Element (<td>) defines a cell that content data.
html-element-docs:tr: The HTML Table Row Element (<tr>) defines a row of cells in a table. Those can be a mix of <td> and <th> elements.
progress.max: This attribute describes how much work the task indicated by the progress element requires.
td.charoff: This attribute is used to indicate the number of characters to offset the column data from the alignment characters specified by the char attribute.
ol.compact: This Boolean attribute hints that the list should be rendered in a compact style.
a.charset: This attribute defines the character encoding of the linked resource.
html-element-docs:i: The HTML Offset Text (or Italics) Element (<i>) represents a range of text that is set off from the normal text for some reason, for example, technical terms, foreign language phrases, or fictional character thoughts. It is typically displayed in italic type.
menu.type: Used to indicate the kind of menu being declared.
html-element-docs:source: The source element is used to specify multiple media resources for audio and video elements in HTML5. It is an empty element. It is commonly used to serve the same media in multiple formats supported by different browsers.
html-element-docs:a: The HTML Anchor Element (<a>) defines a hyperlink, the named target destination for a hyperlink, or both.
html-element-docs:head: The HTML <head> element represents a collection of metadata about the document, including links to or definitions of scripts and style sheets.
html-element-docs:b: The HTML B Element (<b>) represents a span of text stylistically different from normal text, without a conveying any special importance or relevance. It is typically used for keywords in a summary, product names in a review, or other spans of text whose typical presentation would be boldfaced. Another example of its use is to mark the lead sentence of each paragraph of an article.
html-element-docs:caption: The HTML Table Caption Element (<caption>) represents the title of a table. Though it is always the first descendant of a <table> , its styling, using CSS, may place it elsewhere, relative to the table.
html-element-docs:u: The HTML Underline Element (<u>) renders text with an underline, a line under the baseline of its content.
html-element-docs:q: The quote element indicates that the enclosed text is a short inline quotation.
html-element-docs:p: Paragraph element (<p>) represents a paragraph. It is the most commonly used block-level element.
html-element-docs:s: The HTML Strikethrough Element (<s>) renders text with a strike-through, or a line through it. Use the <s> element to represent things that are no longer relevant or no longer accurate. However, <s> is not appropriate when indicating document edits; for that, use the <del> and <ins> elements, as appropriate.
css-property-docs:background-position: The background-position CSS property sets the initial position, relative to the background position layer defined by background-origin for each defined background image.
table.cellspacing: This attribute defines the size, in percentage or in pixels, of the space between two cells (both horizontally and vertically), between the top of the table and the cells of the first row, the left of the table and the first column, the right of the table and the last column and the bottom of the table and the last row.
object.name: The name of valid browsing context (HTML5), or the name of the control (HTML 4).
html-element-docs:title: The HTML Title Element (<title>) defines the title of the document, shown in a browser's title bar or on the page's tab. It can only contain text and any contained tags are not interpreted.
html-element-docs:br: The HTML Line Break element (<br>) produces a line break in text (carriage-return). It is useful for writing a poem or an address, where the division of lines is significant.
th.align: This enumerated attribute specifies how horizontal alignment of each cell content will be handled.
css-property-docs:background-color: The background-color CSS property sets the background colour of an element, either through a color value or the keyword transparent.
fieldset.disabled:
If this Boolean attribute is set, the form controls that are its descendants, except descendants of its first optional <legend>
 element, are disabled, i.e., not editable.
img.longdesc: The URL of a description of the image to be displayed, which supplements the alt text.
input.mozactionhint: Specifies an "action hint" used to determine how to label the enter key on mobile devices with virtual keyboards.
area.media: A hint of the media for which the linked resource was designed, for example print and screen.
html-element-docs:tfoot: The HTML Table Foot Element (<tfoot>) defines a set of rows summarizing the columns of the table.
html-element-docs:span: This HTML element is a generic inline container for phrasing content, which does not inherently represent anything. It can be used to group elements for styling purposes (using the class or id attributes), or because they share attribute values, such as lang. It should be used only when no other semantic element is appropriate. <span> is very much like a <div> element, but <div> is a block-level element whereas a <span> is an inline element.
short-element-descriptions:head: document metadata container
css-property-docs:min-height: The min-height CSS property is used to set the minimum height of a given element. It prevents the used value of the height property from becoming smaller than the value specified for min-height.
css-property-docs:background-attachment: If a background-image is specified, the background-attachment CSS property determines whether that image's position is fixed within the viewport, or scrolls along with its containing block.
html-element-docs:canvas: The Canvas (<canvas>) HTML element can be used to draw graphics via scripting (usually JavaScript). For example, it can be used to draw graphs, make photo compositions or even perform animations.
dl.compact: Forces the definition description to appear at the same line as the definition term.
link.rev:
The value of this attribute shows the relationship of the current document to the linked document, as defined by the 

href
 attribute.
iframe.sandbox: If specified as an empty string, this attribute enables extra restrictions on the content that can appear in the inline frame.
input.usemap:
The name of a <map>
 element to as an image map.
input.formenctype: If the input element is a submit button or image, this attribute specifies the type of content that is used to submit the form to the server.
td.colspan: This attribute contains a non-negative integer value that indicates for how many columns the cell extends.
style.title: Specifies alternative style sheet sets.
css-property-docs:left: The left CSS property specifies part of the position of positioned elements.
menu.label: Gives the label of the menu.
html-element-docs:wbr: The Word Break Opportunity (<wbr>) HTML element represents a position within text where the browser may optionally break a line, though its line-breaking rules would not otherwise create a break at that location.
param.valuetype: This is an obsolete API and is no longer guaranteed to work.
tfoot.char: This attribute is used to set the character to align the cells in a column on.
html-element-docs:table: The HTML Table Element (<table>) represents data in two dimensions or more.
css-property-docs:bottom: The bottom CSS property participates in specifying the position of positioned elements.
body.onbeforeprint: Function to call when the user requests printing of the document.
table.cellpadding: This attribute defines the space between the content of a cell and the border, displayed or not, of it.
Make sure your web browser's bookmarks b: Make sure your web browser's bookmarks bar is enabled.
css-property-docs:font-family: The font-family CSS property allows for a prioritized list of font family names and/or generic family names to be specified for the selected element. Unlike most other CSS properties, values are separated by a comma to indicate that they are alternatives. The browser will select the first font on the list that is installed on the computer, or that can be downloaded using the information provided by a @font-face at-rule.
tr.charoff: This attribute is used to indicate the number of characters to offset the column data from the alignment characters specified by the char attribute.
link.sizes: This attribute defines the sizes of the icons for visual media contained in the resource.
Here is the URL for your remix that anyo: Here is the URL for your remix that anyone can view.
html-element-docs:hgroup: The HTML Headings Group Element (<hgroup>) represents the heading of a section. It defines a single title that participates in the outline of the document as the heading of the implicit or explicit section that it belongs too.
form.target: A name or keyword indicating where to display the response that is received after submitting the form.
html-element-docs:datalist: The HTML Datalist Element (<datalist>) contains a set of <option> elements that represent the possible options for the value of other controls.
th.valign: This attribute specifies the vertical alignment of the text within each row of cells of the table header.
css-property-docs:line-height:
On inline elements, the line-height CSS property specifies the height that is used in the calculation of the line box height.
On block level elements, line-height specifies the minimal height of line boxes within the element.
Click on the image below: Click on the image below, then edit the HTML source code so the image points to the URL you just copied.
iframe.src: The URL of the page to embed.
img.vspace: The number of pixels of white space to insert above and below the image.
body.onunload: Function to call when the document is going away.
too-big-to-remix-html: That <${tagName}> element is too big to remix. Try selecting a smaller one!
form.name: The name of the form.
embed.type: The MIME type to use to select the plug-in to instantiate.
Mess around with the rest of the page!: Mess around with the rest of the page!
object.tabindex: The position of the element in the tabbing navigation order for the current document.
css-property-docs:float: The float CSS property specifies that an element should be taken from the normal flow and placed along the left or right side of its container, where text and inline elements will wrap around it.
Deactivate X-Ray Goggles: Deactivate X-Ray Goggles, then drag the button above into your bookmarks bar.
html-element-docs:article: The HTML Article Element (<article>) represents a self-contained composition in a document, page, application, or site, which is intended to be independently distributable or reusable, e.g., in syndication. This could be a forum post, a magazine or newspaper article, a blog entry, a user-submitted comment, an interactive widget or gadget, or any other independent item of content.
too-big-to-change: That element is too big to remix. Try selecting a smaller one!
html-attribute-docs:class: This attribute is a space-separated list of the classes of the element. Classes allow CSS to style specific elements via class selectors.
input.form: The form element that the input element is associated with (its form owner).
button.formenctype: If the button is a submit button, this attribute specifies the type of content that is used to submit the form to the server.
Instantly publish your remix to a URL th: Instantly publish your remix to a URL that anyone can view.
input.maxlength: If the value of the type attribute is text, email, search, password, tel, or url,  this attribute specifies the maximum number of characters (in Unicode code points) that the user can enter; for other control types, it is ignored.
css-property-docs:display: The display CSS property specifies the type of rendering box used for an element. In HTML, default display property values are taken from behaviours described in the HTML specifications or from the browser/user default stylesheet. The default value in XML is inline.
th.charoff: This attribute is used to indicate the number of characters to offset the column data from the alignment characters specified by the char attribute.
ul.compact: This Boolean attribute hints that the list should be rendered in a compact style.
input.pattern: A regular expression that the control's value is checked against.
dd.nowrap: If the value of this attribute is set to yes, the definition text will not wrap.
html-element-docs:time: The HTML time element (<time>) represents either time on a 24-hour clock or a precise date in the Gregorian calendar (with optional time and timezone information).
css-property-docs:font-weight: The font-weight CSS property specifies the weight or boldness of the font. However, some fonts are not available in all weights; some are available only on normal and bold.
select.selectedIndex:
The index of the selected <option>
 element.
area.hreflang: Indicates the language of the linked resource.
head.profile: The URI's of one or more metadata profiles, separated by white space.
html-element-docs:video: The HTML  <video> element is used to embed video content in an HTML or XHTML document.
area.name: Define a names for the clickable area so that it can be scripted by older browsers.
form.action: The URI of a program that processes the information submitted via the form.
css-property-docs:background-origin: The background-origin CSS property determines the background positioning area, that is the position of the origin of an image specified using the background-image CSS property.
Then click on the highlighted image: Then click on the highlighted image. This will reveal its HTML source code.
html-element-docs:figure: The HTML Figure Element (<figure>) represents self-contained content, frequently with a caption (<figcaption> ), and is typically referenced as a single unit. While it is related to the main flow, its position is independent of the main flow. Usually this is an image, an illustration, a diagram, a code snippet, or a schema that is referenced in the main text, but that can be moved to another page or to an appendix without affecting the main flow.
html-element-docs:base: The HTML Base element (<base>) specifies the base URL to use for all relative URLs contained within a document.
table.align: This enumerated attribute indicates how the table must be aligned in regard of the containing document.
tfoot.valign: This attribute specifies the vertical alignment of the text within each row of cells of the table header.
tr.align: This enumerated attribute specifies how horizontal alignment of each cell content will be handled.
html-element-docs:noscript: The HTML NoScript Element (<noscript>) defines a section of html to be inserted if a script type on the page is unsupported or if scripting is currently turned off in the browser.
meter.high: The lower numeric bound of the high end of the measured range.
Copy this URL to your clipboard.
video.buffered: An attribute you can read to determine which time ranges of the media have been buffered.
html-element-docs:meter: The HTML meter element (<meter>) represents either a scalar value within a known range or a fractional value.
thead.align: This enumerated attribute specifies how horizontal alignment of each cell content will be handled.
body.onerror: Function to call when the document fails to load properly.
output.name: The name of the element.
option.disabled: If this Boolean attribute is set, this option is not checkable.
colgroup.char: This attribute is used to set the character to align the cells in a column on.
html-element-docs:body: The HTML Body (<body>) element represents the main content of an HTML document. There is only one <body> element in a document.
input.step: Works with the min and max attributes to limit the increments at which a numeric or date-time value can be set.
tr.char: This attribute is used to set the character to align the cells in a column on.
css-property-docs:text-overflow: The text-overflow CSS property determines how overflowed content that is not displayed is signaled to the users. It can be clipped, display an ellipsis ('…', U+2026 Horizontal Ellipsis) or a Web author-defined string.
select.form: The form element that the select element is associated with (its "form owner").
button.value: The initial value of the button.
audio.autobuffer: A Boolean attribute; if specified, the audio will automatically begin being downloaded, even if not set to automatically play.
form.novalidate: This Boolean attribute indicates that the form is not to be validated when it is submitted.
textarea.disabled: This Boolean attribute indicates that the user cannot interact with the control.
form.method: The HTTP method that the browser uses to submit the form.
css-property-docs:min-width: The min-width CSS property is used to set the minimum width of a given element. It prevents the used value of the width property from becoming smaller than the value specified for min-width.
colgroup.bgcolor: This attribute defines the background colour of each cell of the columns member of the column group.
input.autocomplete: This attribute indicates whether the value of the control can be automatically completed by the browser.
html-element-docs:ul: The HTML unordered list element (<ul>) represents an unordered list of items, namely a collection of items that do not have a numerical ordering, and their order in the list is meaningless. Typically, unordered-list items are displayed with a bullet, which can be of several forms, like a dot, a circle or a squared. The bullet style is not defined in the HTML description of the page, but in its associated CSS, using the list-style-type property.
td.valign: This attribute specifies the vertical alignment of the text within each row of cells of the table header.
meter.form: This attribute associates the element with a form element that has ownership of the meter element.
link.charset: This attribute defines the character encoding of the linked resource.
iframe.seamless: This Boolean attribute indicates that the browser should render the inline frame in a way that makes it appear to be part of the containing document, for example by applying CSS styles that apply to the <iframe> to the contained document before styles specified in that document, and by opening links in the contained documents in the parent browsing context (unless another setting prevents this).
textarea.wrap: Indicates how the control wraps text.
html-element-docs:progress: The HTML progress (<progress>) element is used to view the completion progress of a task. While the specifics of how it's displayed is left up to the browser developer, it's typically displayed as a progress bar.
object.codetype: The content type of the data specified by classid.
html-element-docs:map: The HTML Map element (<map>) is used with <area> elements to define an image map.
embed.src: The URL of the resource being embedded.
html-element-docs:style: Style element contains style information for a document. Style information should go inside of this element, usually in the CSS language (see CSS).
iframe.marginheight: The amount of space in pixels between the frame's content and its top and bottom margins.
command.disabled: Indicates that the command is not available.
a.href: This is the single required attribute for anchors defining a hypertext source link.
button.formaction: The URI of a program that processes the information submitted by the button.
canvas.height: The height of the coordinate space in CSS pixels.
audio.preload: This enumerated attribute is intended to provide a hint to the browser about what the author thinks will lead to the best user experience.
meter.max: The upper numeric bound of the measured range.
iframe.align: The alignment of this element with respect to the surrounding context.
table.width: This attribute defines the width of the table.
th.char: This attribute is used to set the character to align the cells in a column on.
tr.bgcolor: This attribute defines the background colour of each cell of the row.
html-element-docs:samp: The HTML Sample Text Element (<samp>) produces an inline element displayed in the browser's default monotype font (Lucida Console). This element was intended to identify sample output from a computer program.
col.align: This enumerated attribute specifies how horizontal alignment of each column cell content will be handled.
audio.loop: A Boolean attribute; if specified, we will, upon reaching the end of the audio, automatically seek back to the start.
area.nohref: Indicates that no hyperlink exists for the associated area.
base.target: A name or keyword indicating the default location to display the result, when hyperlinks or forms cause navigation, for elements that do not have an explicit target reference.
html-element-docs:pre: This element represents preformatted text. Text within this element is typically displayed in a non-proportional font exactly as it is laid out in the file. Whitespaces inside this element are displayed as typed.
param.type: Only used if the valuetype is set to "ref".
command.radiogroup: This attribute gives the name of the group of commands, with a type of radio, that will be toggled when the command itself is toggled.
col.char: This attribute is used to set the character to align the cells in a column on.
script.src: This attribute specifies the URI of an external script; this can be used as an alternative to embedding a script directly within a document.
body.onhashchange: Function to call when the fragment identifier part (starting with the hash (#) character) of the document's current address has changed.
ol.reversed: This Boolean attribute specifies that the items of the item are specified in the reverse order, i.e.
html-element-docs:form: The form (<form>) HTML element represents a section of document that contains interactive controls that enable a user to submit information to a web server.
body.alink: Colour of text for hyperlinks when selected.
button.autofocus: This Boolean attribute lets you specify that the button should have input focus when the page loads, unless the user overrides it, for example by typing in a different control.
html-element-docs:legend: The HTML Legend Field Element (<legend>) represents a caption for the content of its parent <fieldset> .
command.type: This attribute indicates the kind of command.
link.media: This attribute specifies the media which the linked resource applies to.
img.ismap: This Boolean attribute indicates that the image is part of a server-side map.
option.label: This attribute is text for the label indicating the meaning of the option.
ins.datetime: This attribute indicates the date and time of the change, and must be a valid date with an optional time string.
object.classid: The URI of the object's implementation.
time.datetime: This attribute indicates the time and date of the element and must be a valid date with an optional time string.
iframe.width:
Indicates the width of the frame 
HTML5 in CSS pixels, or 
HTML 4.01 in pixels or as a percentage.
iframe.scrolling: Enumerated attribute indicating when the browser should provide a scroll bar (or other scrolling device) for the frame:  auto: Only when needed.
body.onbeforeunload: Function to call when the document is about to be unloaded.
default-html: Web X-Ray Goggles activated! Press ESC to deactivate.
area.tabindex: A numeric value specifying the position of the defined area in the browser tabbing order.
html-element-docs:ins: The HTML Inserted Text (<ins>) HTML represents a range of text that has been added to a document.
table.border: This integer attribute defines, in pixels, the size of the frame surrounding the table.
html-element-docs:textarea: The textarea (<textarea> ) HTML element represents a multi-line plain-text editing control.
html-element-docs:thead: The HTML Table Head Element (<thead>) defines a set of rows defining the head of the columns of the table.
When you're ready to share your remixed: When you're ready to share your remixed page, click the Publish button or press <kbd>P</kbd> on your keyboard. This makes your changes visible on the web for others to see.
meta.content:
This attribute gives the value associated with the 

http-equiv
 or 

name
 attribute, depending of the context.
css-property-docs:background-repeat: The background-repeat CSS property defines how background images are repeated. A background image can be repeated along the horizontal axis, the vertical axis, both, or not repeated at all. When the repetition of the image tiles doesn't let them exactly cover the background, the way adjustments are done can be controlled by the author: by default, the last image is clipped, but the different tiles can instead be re-sized, or space can be inserted between the tiles.
input.height: If the value of the type attribute is image, this attribute defines the height of the image displayed for the button.
body.link: Colour of text for unvisited hypertext links.
col.span: This attribute contains a positive integer indicating the number of consecutive columns the <col> element spans.
html-element-docs:label: The HTML Label Element (<label>) represents a caption for an item in a user interface. It can be associated with a control either by using the for attribute, or by placing the control element inside the label element. Such a control is called the labelled control of the label element.
tbody.align: This enumerated attribute specifies how horizontal alignment of each cell content will be handled.
css-property-docs:opacity: The opacity CSS property specifies the transparency of an element, that is, the degree to which the background behind the element is overlaid.
table.rules: This enumerated attribute defines where rules, i.e.
html-element-docs:hr: In HTML5 the <hr> element represents a thematic break between paragraph-level elements (for example, a change of scene in a story, or a shift of topic with a section). In previous versions of HTML, it represented a horizontal rule. It may still be displayed as a horizontal rule in visual browsers, but is now defined in semantic terms, rather than presentational terms.
Drag the yellow button into your bookmar: Drag the yellow "Activate X-Ray Goggles" button into your bookmarks bar, where it will automatically be added as a button that you can click to activate the Goggles on any webpage.
object.type: The MIME type of the resource specified by data.
video.src: The URL of the video to embed.
You can take X-Ray Goggles with you anyw: You can take X-Ray Goggles with you anywhere on the web! Just install it in two easy steps.
area.coords: A set of values specifying the coordinates of the hot-spot region.
hr.align: Deprecated since HTML4.01. Obsolete since HTML5
del.datetime: This attribute indicates the time and date of the change and must be a valid date with an optional time string.
meter.low: The upper numeric bound of the low end of the measured range.
input.formtarget: If the input element is a submit button or image, this attribute is a name or keyword indicating where to display the response that is received after submitting the form.
q.cite: The value of this attribute is a URL that designates a source document or message for the information quoted.
command.icon: Gives a picture which represents the command.
iframe.frameborder: The value 1 (the default) tells the browser to draw a border between this frame and every other frame.
label.form: The form element that the label element is associated with (its form owner).
tbody.bgcolor: This attribute defines the background colour of each cell of the column.
caption.align: This enumerated attribute indicates how the caption must be aligned with respect to the table.
html-element-docs:code: The HTML Code Element (<code>) represents a fragment of computer code. By default, it is displayed in the browser's default monospace font.
th.headers:
This attributes a list of space-separated strings, each corresponding to the id attribute of the <th>
 elements that applies to this element.
col.width: This attribute specifies a default width for each column in the current column group.
input.name: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.
html-element-docs:kbd: The HTML Keyboard Input Element (<kbd>) produces an inline element displayed in the browser's default monotype font. This element is used to identify user input.
html-element-docs:h1: Heading elements implement six levels of document headings, <h1> is the most important and <h6> is the least. A heading element briefly describes the topic of the section it introduces. Heading information may be used by user agents, for example, to construct a table of contents for a document automatically.
iframe.longdesc: A URI of a long description of the frame.
css-property-docs:right: The right CSS property specifies part of the position of positioned elements.
a.coords: For use with object shapes, this attribute uses a comma-separated list of numbers to define the coordinates of the object on the page.
keygen.name: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.
th.rowspan: This attribute contains a non-negative integer value that indicates on how many rows does the cell extend.
tbody.charoff: This attribute is used to indicate the number of characters to offset the column data from the alignment characters specified by the char attribute.
area.href: The hyperlink target for the area.
css-property-docs:vertical-align: The vertical-align CSS property specifies the vertical alignment of an inline or table-cell element.
select.size: If the control is presented as a scrolled list box, this attribute represents the number of rows in the list that should be visible at one time.
option.selected: If present, this Boolean attribute indicates that the option is initially selected.
option.value: The textual content of this attribute represents the label explaining the option.
form.autocomplete: Indicates whether controls in this form can by default have their values automatically completed by the browser.
select.name: The name of the control.
short-element-descriptions:title: document title
keygen.form: The form element that this element is associated with (its form owner).
css-property-docs:list-style-image: The list-style-image CSS property sets the image that will be used as the list item marker. It is often more convenient to use the shortcut list-style .
td.bgcolor: This attribute defines the background colour of each cell of the column.
html-attribute-docs:title: This attribute contains a text representing advisory information related to the element it belongs to. Such information can typically, but not necessarily, be presented to the user as a tooltip.
html-element-docs:img: The HTML Image Element (<img>) represents an image to the document.
html-element-docs:input: The input (<input>) element is used to create interactive controls for web-based forms.
select.required: A Boolean attribute indicating that an option with a non-empty string value must be selected.
html-element-docs:html: The HTML root element (<html>) represents the root of an HTML or XHTML document. All other elements must be descendants of this element.
textarea.maxlength: The maximum number of characters (Unicode code points) that the user can enter.
html-element-docs:link: The HTML Link Element (<link>) specifies relationships between the current document and other documents. Possible uses for this element include defining a relational framework for navigation and linking the document to a style sheet.
input.autofocus: This Boolean attribute lets you specify that a form control should have input focus when the page loads, unless the user overrides it, for example by typing in a different control.
video.loop: A Boolean attribute; if specified, we will, upon reaching the end of the video, automatically seek back to the start.
iframe.webkitallowfullscreen:
In Chrome 17 or later (and maybe earlier), this attribute can be set to true if the frame is allowed to be placed into full screen mode by calling its element.webkitRequestFullScreen()
 method.
source.src: Required, address of the media resource.
input.placeholder: A hint to the user of what can be entered in the control .
td.headers:
This attributes a list of space-separated strings, each corresponding to the id attribute of the <th>
 elements that applies to this element.
tbody.valign: This attribute specifies the vertical alignment of the text within each row of cells of the table header.
object.standby: A message that the browser can show while loading the object's implementation and data.
table.summary: This attribute defines an alternative text use to describe the table in user-agent unable to display it.
area.rel: For anchors containing the href attribute, this attribute specifies the relationship of the target object to the link object.
area.type: This attribute specifies the media type in the form of a MIME type for the link target.
style.scoped: If this attribute is present, then style applies only to its parent element.
iframe.marginwidth: The amount of space in pixels between the frame's content and its left and right margins.
link.target: Defines the frame or window name that has the defined linking relationship or that will show the rendering of any linked resource.
br.clear: Indicates where to begin the next line after the break.
td.align: This enumerated attribute specifies how horizontal alignment of each cell content will be handled.
html-element-docs:header: The HTML Header Element (<header>) represents a group of introductory or navigational aids. It may contain some heading elements but also other elements like a logo, wrapped section's header, a search form, and so on.
html-element-docs:dt: The HTML Definition Term Element (<dt>) identifies a term in a definition list. This element can occur only as a child element of a <dl> . It is usually followed by a <dd> element; however, multiple <dt> elements in a row indicate several terms that are all defined by the immediate next <dd> element.
With X-Ray Goggles activated: With X-Ray Goggles activated, press <kbd>H</kbd> for help.
link.rel: This attribute names a relationship of the linked document to the current document.
html-element-docs:dl: The HTML Definition List (<dl>) element encloses a list of pairs of terms and descriptions. A common use for this element is to implement a glossary.
Sorry, an error occurred. Please try aga: Sorry, an error occurred. Please try again later.
html-element-docs:output: The output (<output>) element represents the result of a calculation.
html-element-docs:sub: The HTML Subscript Element (<sub>) defines a span of text that should be displayed, for typographic reasons, lower, and often smaller, than the main span of text.
html-element-docs:footer: The HTML Footer Element (<footer>) represents a footer for its nearest sectioning content or sectioning root element (i.e, its nearest parent <article> , <aside> , <nav> , <section> , <blockquote> , <body> , <details> , <fieldset> , <figure> , <td> ). A footer typically contains information about the author of the section, copyright data or links to related documents.
html-element-docs:embed: The HTML Embed Element (<embed>) represents an integration point for an external application or interactive content (in other words, a plug-in).
html-element-docs:var: The HTML Variable Element (<var>) represents a variable in a mathematical expression or a programming context.
html-element-docs:menu: The HTML menu element (<menu>) represents an unordered list of menu choices, or commands.
th.abbr: This attribute contains a short abbreviated description of the content of the cell.
html-element-docs:sup: The HTML Superscript Element (<sup>) defines a span of text that should be displayed, for typographic reasons, higher, and often smaller, than the main span of text.
unload-blocked: You have made unsaved changes to this page.
audio.autoplay: A Boolean attribute; if specified (even if the value is "false"!), the audio will automatically begin to play back as soon as it can do so without stopping to finish loading the data.
a.shape: This attribute is used to define a selectable region for hypertext source links associated with a figure to create an image map.
body.onundo: Function to call when the user has moved backward in undo transaction history.
meter.min: The lower numeric bound of the measured range.
th.scope:
This enumerated attribute defines the cells that the header defined in this <th>
 element relates to.
a.ping: The support for "ping" was disabled starting with Firefox 3 beta 3.
input.required: This attribute specifies that the user must fill in a value before submitting a form.
col.charoff: This attribute is used to indicate the number of characters to offset the column data from the alignment characters specified by the char attribute.
a.rel: For anchours containing the href attribute, this attribute specifies the relationship of the target object to the link object.
body.vlink: Colour of text for visited hypertext links.
keygen.autofocus: This Boolean attribute lets you specify that the control should have input focus when the page loads, unless the user overrides it, for example by typing in a different control.
source.media: Media query of the resource's intended media.
embed.width: The displayed width of the resource, in CSS pixels.
a.rev: This attribute specifies a reverse link, the inverse relationship of the rel attribute.
img.crossorigin: This enumerated attribute indicates if the fetching of the related image must be done using CORS or not.
input.multiple: This Boolean attribute indicates whether the user can enter more than one value.
input.formaction: The URI of a program that processes the information submitted by the input element, if it is a submit button or image.
colgroup.align: This enumerated attribute specifies how horizontal alignment of each column cell content will be handled.
textarea.readonly: This Boolean attribute indicates that the user cannot modify the value of the control.
object.height: The height of the displayed resource, in CSS pixels.
canvas.width: The width of the coordinate space in CSS pixels.
label.accesskey: A shortcut key to access this element from the keyboard.
col.valign: This attribute specifies the vertical alignment of the text within each cell of the column.
del.cite: A URI for a resource that explains the change (for example, meeting minutes).
input.min: The minimum (numeric or date-time) value for this item, which must not be greater than its maximum (max attribute) value.
video.muted: A Boolean attribute which indicates the default setting of the audio contained in the video.
body.onpopstate: Function to call when the user has navigated session history.
button.name: The name of the button, which is submitted with the form data.
a.hreflang: This attribute indicates the language of the linked resource.
audio.src: The URL of the audio to embed.
td.abbr: This attribute contains a short abbreviated description of the content of the cell.
style.disabled: If set, disables (does not apply) the style rules to the Document that are specified within the element.
command.checked: Indicates whether the command is selected.
Sign in to publish your remix: Sign in to publish your remix
img.height:
The height of the image in 
HTML5 CSS pixels, or 
HTML 4 in pixels or as a percentage.
body.onfocus: Function to call when the document receives focus.
html-element-docs:script: The script element is used to embed or reference an executable script within an HTML or XHTML document.
a.urn: This supposedly Microsoft-supported attribute relates a uniform resource name (URN) with the link.
tap-space-html:
Tap
space bar
to edit this style.
hr.noshade: Deprecated since HTML4.01. Obsolete since HTML5
form.accept-charset: A list of character encodings that the server accepts.
table.frame: This enumerated attribute defines which side of the frame surrounding the table must be displayed.
video.preload: This enumerated attribute is intended to provide a hint to the browser about what the author thinks will lead to the best user experience.
If you need help: If you need help, make sure the X-Ray Goggles are activated, then press <kbd>H</kbd> on your keyboard.
form.accept: A comma-separated list of content types that the server accepts.
time.pubdate: (This feature is still being discussed by the WHATWG and the W3C HTML5 Working Group.) This Boolean attribute specifies that the date and time given by the element is the publication date of a document.
activate the X-Ray Goggles by: Next, activate the X-Ray Goggles by clicking the yellow button above.
textarea.cols: The visible width of the text control, in average character widths.
object.border: The width of a border around the control, in pixels.
area.target: This attribute specifies where to display the linked resource.
td.char: This attribute is used to set the character to align the cells in a column on.
input.accept: If the value of the type attribute is file, this attribute indicates the types of files that the server accepts; otherwise it is ignored.
source.type: The MIME-type of the resource, optionally with a codec parameter.
html-element-docs:command: The command element represents a command which the user can invoke.
input.size: The initial size of the control.
fieldset.form:
This attribute has the value of the id attribute of the <form>
 element its related to.
css-property-docs:font-variant: The font-variant CSS property selects a normal, or small-caps face from a font family. Setting font-variant is also possible by using the font shorthand.
html-element-docs:keygen: The HTML keygen element exists to facilitate generation of key material, and submission of the public key as part of an HTML form. This mechanism is designed for use with Web-based certificate management systems. It is expected that the keygen element will be used in an HTML form along with other information needed to construct a certificate request, and that the result of the process will be a signed certificate.
command.label: The name of the command as shown to the user.
input.formmethod: If the input element is a submit button or image, this attribute specifies the HTTP method that the browser uses to submit the form.
a.media: This attribute specifies the media which the linked resource applies to.
css-property-docs:white-space: The white-space CSS property is used to describe how whitespace inside the element is handled.
img.hspace: The number of pixels of white space to insert to the left and right of the image.
meta.scheme: This attribute defines the scheme in which the metadata is described.
area.alt: A text string alternative to display on browsers that do not display images.
style.media: Which media should this style apply to.
td.rowspan: This attribute contains a non-negative integer value that indicates for how many rows the cell extends.
input.type: The type of control to display.
html-element-docs:del: The Deleted Text (<del>) HTML element represents a range of text that has been deleted from a document. This element is often (but need not be) rendered with strike-through text.
thead.valign: This attribute specifies the vertical alignment of the text within each row of cells of the table header.
css-property-docs:clear: The clear CSS property specifies whether an element can be next to floating elements that precede it or must be moved down (cleared) below them.
embed.height: The displayed height of the resource, in CSS pixels.
See how Goggles work by swapping a image: See how Goggles work by swapping an image
input.disabled: This Boolean attribute indicates that the form control is not available for interaction.
progress.form: This attribute specifies the form which the progress element belongs to.
iframe.mozallowfullscreen:
In Gecko 9.0 or later, this attribute can be set to true if the frame is allowed to be placed into full screen mode by calling its element.mozRequestFullScreen()
 method.
textarea.name: The name of the control.
object.usemap:
A hash-name reference to a <map>
 element; that is a '#' followed by the value of a 

name
 of a map element.
select.multiple: This Boolean attribute indicates that multiple options can be selected in the list.
button.formtarget: If the button is a submit button, this attribute is a name or keyword indicating where to display the response that is received after submitting the form.
Find the current X-Ray Goggles image: Find the current X-Ray Goggles image (shown below) and hover over it until it highlights.
script.type: This attribute identifies the scripting language of code embedded within a script element or referenced via the element’s src attribute.
html-element-docs:select: The select (<select>) HTML element represents a control that presents menu of options. The options within the menu are represented by <option> elements, which can be grouped by <optgroup> elements. Options can be pre-selected for the user.
audio.buffered: An attribute you can read to determine which time ranges of the media have been buffered.
audio.mozCurrentSampleOffset: The offset, specified as the number of samples since the beginning of the audio stream, at which the audio is currently playing.
link.methods: The value of this attribute provides information about the functions that might be performed on an object.
meta.http-equiv: This enumerated attribute defines the pragma that can alter servers and user-agents' behaviour.
html-element-docs:iframe: The HTML inline frame element (<iframe>) represents a nested browsing context, effectively embedding another HTML page into the current page. Each browsing context has its own session history and active document. The browsing context that contains the embedded content is called the parent browsing context. The top-level browsing context (which has no parent) is typically the browser window.
video.height: The height of the video's display area, in CSS pixels.
Activate X-Ray Goggles by clicking the y: Activate X-Ray Goggles by clicking the yellow button above.
css-property-docs:letter-spacing: The letter-spacing CSS property specifies spacing behaviour between text characters.
css-property-docs:z-index: The z-index CSS property specifies the z-order of an element and its descendants. When elements overlap, z-order determines which one covers the other. An element with a larger z-index generally covers an element with a lower one.
html-element-docs:section: The HTML Section Element (<section>) represents a generic section of a document, i.e., a thematic grouping of content, typically with a heading.
input.list: Identifies a list of pre-defined options to suggest to the user.
ins.cite: This attribute defines the URI of a resource that explains the change, like a link to some meeting minutes or a ticket in a troubleshooting system.
a.datafld: This attribute specifies the column name from that data source object that supplies the bound data.
html-element-docs:summary: The HTML summary element (<summary>) is used as a summary, caption or legend for the content of a <details> element.
video.autoplay: A Boolean attribute; if specified, the video will automatically begin to play back as soon as it can do so without stopping to finish loading the data.
ol.start: This integer attribute specifies the start value for numbering the individual list items.
select.autofocus: This attribute lets you specify that a form control should have input focus when the page loads, unless the user overrides it, for example by typing in a different control.
form.enctype: When the value of the method attribute is post, this attribute is the MIME type of content that is used to submit the form to the server.
css-property-docs:background-image: The background-image CSS property sets the background images for an element. The images are drawn on successive stacking context layers, with the first specified being drawn as if it is the closest to the user. The borders of the element are then drawn on top of them, and the background-color is drawn beneath them.
img.src: Image URL, this attribute is obligatory for the element.
html-element-docs:li: The HTML List item element (<li>) is used to represent a list item. It should be contained in an ordered list (<ol>), an unordered list (<ul>) or a menu (<menu>), where it represents a single entity in that list.
a.methods: The value of this attribute provides information about the functions that might be performed on an object.
css-property-docs:word-spacing: The word-spacing CSS property specifies spacing behaviour between tags and words.
a.target: This attribute specifies where to display the linked resource.
optgroup.disabled: If this Boolean attribute is set, none of the items in this option group is selectable.
td.scope: This is an obsolete API and is no longer guaranteed to work in HTML5
css-property-docs:background-size: The background-size CSS property specifies the size of the background images.
img.width: The width of the image in pixels or percent.
With X-Ray Goggles now activated: With X-Ray Goggles now activated, mouse around the page. Notice how images and text are highlighted with colours?
css-property-docs:background-clip: The background-clip CSS property specifies whether an element's background, either the colour or image, extends underneath its border.
You can take X-Ray Goggles with you anyw: You can take X-Ray Goggles with you anywhere on the web:
html-element-docs:aside: The HTML Aside Element (<aside>) represents a section of a page that consists of content that is tangentially related to the content around it, which could be considered separate from that content. Such sections are often represented as sidebars or as inserts; they often contains side explanation like a glossary definition, more loosely related stuff like advertisements, the biography of the author, or in web-applications, profile information or related blog links.
html-attribute-docs:style: This attribute contains CSS styling declarations to be applied to the element.
html-element-docs:dfn: The Definition (<dfn>) HTML element represents the defining instance of a term.
video.controls: If this attribute is present, Gecko will offer controls to allow the user to control video playback, including volume, seeking, and pause/resume playback.
button.formnovalidate: If the button is a submit button, this Boolean attribute specifies that the form is not to be validated when it is submitted.
css-property-docs:text-indent: The text-indent CSS property specifies how much horizontal space should be left before the beginning of the first line of the text content of an element. Horizontal spacing is with respect to the left (or right, for right-to-left layout) edge of the containing block element's box.
short-element-descriptions:label: form control label
body.onblur: Function to call when the document loses focus.
area.shape: The shape of the associated hot spot.
body.onredo: Function to call when the user has moved forward in undo transaction history.
body.background: URI of an image to use as a background.
css-quasimode: View/edit computed style of selected element
css-property-docs:text-align: The text-align CSS property describes how inline content like text is aligned in its parent block element. text-align does not control the alignment of block elements itself, only their inline content.
button.form: The form element that the button is associated with (its form owner).
thead.charoff: This attribute is used to indicate the number of characters to offset the column data from the alignment characters specified by the char attribute.
css-property-docs:text-decoration: The text-decoration CSS property is used to set the text formatting underline, overline, line-through and blink.
img.usemap: The partial URL (starting with '#') of an image map associated with the element.
html.version: Specifies the version of the HTML Document Type Definition that governs the current document.
blockquote.cite: A URL that designates a source document or message for the information quoted.
textarea.rows: The number of visible text lines for the control.
html-element-docs:small: The HTML Small Element (<small>) makes the text font size one size smaller (for example, from large to medium, or from small to x-small) down to the browser's minimum font size.
hr.width: Sets the length of the rule on the page through a pixel or percentage value.
html-element-docs:details: The HTML details element (<details>) is used as a disclosure widget from which the user can retrieve additional information.
html-element-docs:bdo: The HTML Bidirectional Override Element (<bdo>) is used to override the current directionality of text. It causes the directionality of the characters to be ignored in favour of the specified directionality.
html-element-docs:bdi: The HTML Bi-directional Isolation Element (<bdi>) isolates a span of text that might be formatted in a different direction from other text outside it.
param.name: Name of the parameter.
ol.type: Indicates the numbering type:  'a' indicates lowercase letters,  ' A' indicates uppercase letters, 'i' indicates lowercase Roman numerals, 'I' indicates uppercase Roman numerals, and '1' indicates numbers.
details.open: This Boolean attribute indicates whether the details will be shown to the user on page load.
button.disabled: This Boolean attribute indicates that the user cannot interact with the button.
css-property-docs:top: The top CSS property specifies part of the position of positioned elements. It has no effect on non-positioned elements.
css-property-docs:width: The width CSS property specifies the width of the content area of an element. The content area is inside the padding, border, and margin of the element.
col.bgcolor: This attribute defines the background colour of each cell of the column.
html-element-docs:meta: The HTML Meta Element (<meta>) represents any metadata information which cannot be represented using one of the other meta-related element (<base> , <link> , <script> , <style> or <title> ). According to the attributes set, the kind of metadata can be one of the following:
script.async: Set this Boolean attribute to indicate that the browser should, if possible, execute the script asynchronously.
textarea.form: The form element that the textarea element is associated with (its "form owner").
tfoot.charoff: This attribute is used to indicate the number of characters to offset the column data from the alignment characters specified by the char attribute.
input.width: If the value of the type attribute is image, this attribute defines the width of the image displayed for the button.
The URL you just copied links to a new i: The URL you just copied links to a new image!
keygen.challenge: A challenge string that is submitted along with the public key.
img.align: The alignment of the image with respect to its surrounding context.
input.src: If the value of the type attribute is image, this attribute specifies a URI for the location of an image to display on the graphical submit button; otherwise it is ignored.
html-element-docs:option: In a web form, the HTML option element (<option>) is used to create a control representing an item within a <select> , an <optgroup> or a <datalist> HTML5 element.
css-property-docs:text-shadow: The text-shadow CSS property adds shadows to text. It accepts a comma-separated list of shadows to be applied to the text and text-decorations of the element.
textarea.selectionDirection: The direction in which selection occurred.
label.for: The ID of a labelable form-related element in the same document as the label element.
object.archive: A space-separated list of URIs for archives of resources for the object.
Make sure your browser's bookmarks bar i: Make sure your browser's bookmarks bar is enabled.
link.disabled: This attribute is used to disable a link relationship.
hr.size: Deprecated since HTML4.01. Obsolete since HTML5
th.colspan: This attribute contains a non-negative integer value that indicates on how many columns the cell extends.
html-attribute-docs:id: This attribute defines a unique identifier (ID) which must be unique in the whole document. Its purpose is to identify the element when linking (using a fragment identifier), scripting, or styling (with CSS).
textarea.autofocus: This Boolean attribute lets you specify that a form control should have input focus when the page loads, unless the user overrides it, for example by typing in a different control.
body.ononline: Function to call when network communication has been restored.
html-element-docs:em: The HTML Emphasis Element (<em>) marks text that has stress emphasis. The <em> element can be nested, with each level of nesting indicating a greater degree of emphasis.
Replace the image location: Replace the image location (or "source", written in HTML as "src") with the URL you copied in Step 1.
td.axis: This attribute contains a list of space-separated strings.
object.declare: The presence of this Boolean attribute makes this element a declaration only.
img.alt: This attribute defines the alternative text describing the image.
html-element-docs:colgroup: The HTML Table Column Group Element (<colgroup>) defines a group of column within a table.
object.width: The width of the display resource, in CSS pixels.
th.bgcolor: This attribute defines the background colour of each cell of the column.
input.formnovalidate: If the input element is a submit button or image, this Boolean attribute specifies that the form is not to be validated when it is submitted.
tbody.char: This attribute is used to set the character to align the cells in a column on.
style.type: This attribute defines the styling language as a MIME type (charset should not be specified).
img.border: The width of a border around the image.
html-element-docs:optgroup: In a web form, the HTML optgroup element (<optgroup>) creates a grouping of options within a <select> element.
html.manifest: Specifies the URI of a resource manifest indicating resources that should be cached locally.
script.language: Like the type attribute, this attribute identifies the scripting language in use.
output.for: A list of IDs of other elements, indicating that those elements contributed input values to (or otherwise affected) the calculation.
input.value: The initial value of the control.
css-property-docs:list-style-position: The list-style-position CSS property specifies the position of the marker box in the principal block box. It is often more convenient to use the shortcut list-style.
body.onstorage: Function to call when the storage area has changed.
html-element-docs:figcaption: The HTML Figcaption Element (<figcaption>) represents a caption or a legend associated with a figure or an illustration described by the rest of the data of the <figure> element which is its immediate ancestor which means <figcaption> can be the first or last element inside a <figure> block. Also, the HTML Figcaption Element is optional; if not provided, then the parent figure element will have no caption.
textarea.placeholder: A hint to the user of what can be entered in the control.
ul.type: Used to set the bullet style for the list.
progress.value: This attribute specifies how much of the task that has been completed.
iframe.srcdoc: The content of the page that the embedded context is to contain.
meter.optimum: This attribute indicates the optimal numeric value.
body.onoffline: Function to call when network communication has failed.
hr.color: Sets the colour of the rule through color name or hexadecimal value.
meta.charset: This attribute declares the character encoding used for the page.
html-element-docs:abbr: The HTML Abbreviation Element (<abbr>) represents an abbreviation and optionally provides a full description for it. If present, the title attribute must contain this full description and nothing else.
html-element-docs:address: The HTML Address Element (<address>) may be used by authors to supply contact information for its nearest <article> or <body> ancestor; in the later case, it applies to the whole document.
css-property-docs:height: The height CSS property specifies the height of the content area of an element. The content area is inside the padding, border, and margin of the element.
select.disabled: This Boolean attribute indicates that the user cannot interact with the control.
css-property-docs:font-style: The font-style CSS property allows italic or oblique faces to be selected within a font-family.
object.form: The form element, if any, that the object element is associated with (its form owner).
css-property-docs:position: The position CSS property chooses alternative rules for positioning elements, designed to be useful for scripted animation effects.
base.href: The base URL to be used throughout the document for relative URL addresses.
video.autobuffer: A Boolean attribute; if specified, the video will automatically begin buffering even if it's not set to automatically play.
video.poster: A URL indicating a poster frame to show until the user plays or seeks.
html-element-docs:blockquote: The HTML Block Quotation (<blockquote>) element indicates that the enclosed text is an extended quotation. Usually, this is rendered visually by indentation (see Notes for how to change it). A URL for the source of the quotation may be given using the cite attribute, while a text representation of the source can be given using the <cite> element.
input.selectionDirection: The direction in which selection occurred.
colgroup.valign: This attribute specifies the vertical alignment of the text within each cell of the column.
colgroup.span: This attribute contains a positive integer indicating the number of additional consecutive columns to apply to the attributes of the <column> element.
a.type: This attribute specifies the media type in the form of a MIME type for the link target.
body.onmessage: Function to call when the document has received a message.
css-property-docs:text-rendering: The text-rendering CSS property provides information to the rendering engine about what to optimize for when rendering text. The browser makes trade-offs among speed, legibility, and geometric precision. The text-rendering property is an SVG property that is not defined in any CSS standard. However, Gecko and WebKit browsers let you apply this property to HTML and XML content on Windows, Mac OS X and Linux
area.accesskey: Specifies a keyboard navigation accelerator for the element.
input.readonly: This Boolean attribute indicates that the user cannot modify the value of the control.
css-property-docs:direction: The direction CSS property should be set to match the direction of the text: rtl for Hebrew or Arabic text and ltr for other scripts. This should normally be done as part of the document (e.g., using the dir attribute in HTML) rather than through direct use of CSS.
body.onresize: Function to call when the document has been resized.
input.checked: When the value of the type attribute is radio or checkbox, the presence of this Boolean attribute indicates that the control is selected by default; otherwise it is ignored.
object.data: The address of the resource as a valid URL.
html-element-docs:ol: The HTML ordered list element (<ol>) represents an ordered list of items. Typically, ordered-list items are displayed with a preceding numbering, which can be of any form, like numerals, letters or Romans numerals or even simple bullets. This numbered style is not defined in the HTML description of the page, but in its associated CSS, using the list-style-type property.
tr.valign: This attribute specifies the vertical alignment of the text within each row of cells of the table header.
tfoot.align: This enumerated attribute specifies how horizontal alignment of each cell content will be handled.
object.codebase: The base path used to resolve relative URIs specified by classid, data, or archive.
colgroup.width: This attribute specifies a default width for each column in the current column group.
link.type: This attribute is used to define the type of the content linked to.
a.name: This attribute is required in an anchor defining a target location within a page.
textarea.selectionEnd: The index to the last character in the current selection.
link.href: This attribute specifies the URL of the linked resource.
css-property-docs:word-wrap: The word-wrap CSS property is used to to specify whether or not the browser is allowed to break lines within words in order to prevent overflow when an otherwise unbreakable string is too long to fit.
iframe.name: A name for the embedded browsing context (or frame).
html-element-docs:button: The button (<button>) HTML element represents a clickable button.
css-property-docs:visibility: The visibility CSS property is used for two things:
tfoot.bgcolor: This attribute defines the background colour of each cell of the column.
th.axis: This attribute contains a list of space-separated strings.
html-element-docs:area: The HTML Area element (<area>) defines a hot-spot region on an image, and optionally associates it with a hypertext link. This element is used only within a <map> element.
html-element-docs:nav: The HTML Navigation Element (<nav>) represents a section of a page that links to other pages or to parts within the page: a section with navigation links.
button.formmethod: If the button is a submit button, this attribute specifies the HTTP method that the browser uses to submit the form.
input.x-moz-errormessage: This Mozilla extension allows you to specify the error message to display when a field doesn't successfully validate.
textarea.selectionStart: The index to the first character in the current selection.

script.defer: This Boolean attribute is set to indicate to a browser that the script is meant to be executed after the document has been parsed.
img.name: A name for the element.
html-element-docs:tbody: The HTML Table Body Element (<tbody>) defines a set of rows defining the body of the table. Though not mandatory, as the rows of the body can be defined as <tr>⏎ elements children of the parent <table>⏎ element, if present, all <tr>⏎ elements part of the body must be included into a unique <tbody>⏎ element.
html-element-docs:mark: The HTML Mark Element (<mark>) represents highlighted text, i.e., a run of text marked for reference purpose, due to its relevance in a particular context. For example it can be used in a page showing search results to highlight every instance of the searched for word.
input.max: The maximum (numeric or date-time) value for this item, which must not be less than its minimum (min attribute) value.
short-element-descriptions:caption: table caption
iframe.height:
Indicates the height of the frame 
HTML5 in CSS pixels, or 
HTML 4.01 in pixels or as a percentage.
